chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Abraham Valdovinos in court.  Attorney Frederick F Klimetz in court for Abraham Valdovinos.  Attorney Stephanie Krueger in court for State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests a plea/sentencing date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  This matter will be held in person in Room 634 of the Courthouse.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 19, 2023 at 02:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 10-25-2022
Received and Filed.

Defendant Abraham Valdovinos appeared by video.  Attorney Frederick F Klimetz appeared by video for Abraham Valdovinos.  Attorney Stephanie Krueger in court for State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests another status date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Status conference scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 9.27.22
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Status Report 9.16.22

Defendant Abraham Valdovinos appeared by video.  Attorney Frederick F Klimetz appeared by phone for Abraham Valdovinos.  Attorney Stephanie Krueger appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests a status date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Status conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 9.2.22

Defendant Abraham Valdovinos in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz, appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire & Waiver
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 7.29.22

Defendant Abraham Valdovinos in court.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Branch 02 for Branch 40
Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel. Court appoints attorney Fred Klimetz, present in court, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The Court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $50.00 per month beginning 09-01-2022, and then the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Case adjourned for Preliminary Hearing, Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 7.18.22

Indigency Hearing was originally scheduled for Branch 40. Court is down on July 18. 

Indigency hearing on July 18, 2022 at 08:30 am in Branch 02 for Branch 40.

All parties notified.

Court ordered no contact with Oak Creek Police Department (unless arrested/reporting a crime); No Violent Contact with Law Enforcement,;
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain. Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Abraham Valdovinos in court with attorney Maryann Corea.  Defendant Abraham Valdovinos in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Abraham Valdovinos appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.   DEFENDANT IS NOT INDIGENT. Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he  may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Indigency hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7/22/22 @ 1p
